description: This file implements a Redis-based in-memory database class for managing memory objects, including methods for creating, reading, updating, deleting, and checking existence of memories, with integration to Redis server.

classes.name: RedisMemoryDb
classes.description: A class that provides Redis-backed in-memory storage for MemoryRow objects, supporting CRUD operations and connection management.

methods.name: __init__
methods.description: Initializes the RedisMemoryDb with connection parameters and sets up the Redis client.

methods.name: __dict__
methods.description: Returns a dictionary representation of the RedisMemoryDb instance.

methods.name: _get_key
methods.description: Generates a Redis key for a given memory ID.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Tests the connection to Redis to ensure it's reachable.

methods.name: memory_exists
methods.description: Checks if a specific memory exists in Redis.

methods.name: read_memories
methods.description: Reads and returns a list of MemoryRow objects from Redis, with optional filtering, sorting, and limiting.

methods.name: upsert_memory
methods.description: Inserts or updates a MemoryRow object in Redis, setting timestamps and optional expiration.

methods.name: delete_memory
methods.description: Deletes a memory from Redis by its ID.

methods.name: drop_table
methods.description: Clears all memories from Redis with the specified prefix.

methods.name: table_exists
methods.description: Checks if any memories exist in Redis with the current prefix.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Deletes all memories matching the prefix pattern from Redis.
